page.title: 09SPRINGS FARM
page.content: SPRINGS FARM. The farmhouse was built in 1734 and most of the original buildings are still there, but many have been reroofed and some altered. No boy had been born in the house for over 200 years until a son was born to the present owners in 1980. The farm is a dairy farm with 100 dairy cattle and 70 replacement cattle(young ones) and 30 beef cattle.The beef cattle are sold at Chippenham market.Two men are employed, a herdsman who looks after the cattle and a tractor driver who looks after the feeding of the animals.The working day starts at 7 with breakfast at 9. After lunch at 1 o'clock the farmer often has office work to do.The family enjoy their life,using the car to go shopping and to church in Wapley and the farmer is sometimes involved in local politics.
